thread.title: Watch: Seahawks’ Bobby Wagner returns Bengals fumble for a touchdown
thread.title_full: Watch: Seahawks’ Bobby Wagner returns Bengals fumble for a touchdown | The Seattle Times

author: Paul Barrett
title: Watch: Seahawks’ Bobby Wagner returns Bengals fumble for a touchdown
text:
The Seahawks pulled away from the Bengals on Sunday in Cincinnati thanks to a defensive touchdown scored by Bobby Wagner and made possible by Michael Bennett.
The Bengals trailed 17-7 in the third quarter and had the ball on first-and-10 at their 25-yard line. Running back Rex Burkhead took the handoff from Andy Dalton but was hit by Seahawks defensive lineman Bennett, who forced Burkhead the fumble.
SEAHAWKS AT BENGALS » Photo gallery Full coverage Seahawks again fail to hold late lead Web reaction: Fans, media on Seahawks' 'devastating' loss to Bengals Grades: Low marks for Seahawks' late struggles Full game highlights Bengals 27, Seahawks 24: First impressions from Condotta, Jenks, Stone Bobby Wagner recovers fumble for TD Thomas Rawls scores on 69-yard TD run Earl Thomas snags Seattle's 1st pick of season; Michael Bennett negates return Russell Wilson hits Jermaine Kearse for 30-yard touchdown Jon Ryan fires back at Brian Billick's 'kickers aren't football players' comment Matt Calkins: Marshawn Lynch may go from Beast Mode to Decreased Mode Linebacker Wagner scooped up the ball at the 23-yard line and took it into the end zone untouched. The extra point made it 24-7, Seahawks.
#TOUCHDOWN SEAHAWKS! @mosesbread72 causes #fumble and @Bwagz54 takes it in for a 24-7 lead.

 #SEAvsCIN pic.twitter.com/xPwTN8O3LC 
— Seattle Seahawks (@Seahawks) October 11, 2015 
Paul Barrett : pbarrett@seattletimes.com .
